ngiemboon: Tóŋ pʉ̀a pendyɛ̀ʼɛ pi lâ pɔ́ tó.
en: Call the other people to come.

ngiemboon: À la nyɛ́te tetʉ́a yé tà á gwɔ́ pepàba.
en: He arranged his yard so well that it is flat.
The child is wearing the red outfit.
that one (distant demonstrative pronoun that refers to class 2 nouns)

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńkwoŋo yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ pépɛ̌.

en: He has animals that are black.
how many ...? (question for nouns from class 2)
How many people came to this house?

ngiemboon: À la gʉa ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pesẅé.
en: He had gone to call the new people.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtyé legwaŋ ńne ńjúu menɔ̀ɔn, tà pi jú pezẅìŋ.
en: If you come to the market to buy the pigs, do not buy the old ones.
by that (adverb + demonstrative adjective as a suffix)
by there (adverb + demonstrative adjective as a suffix)

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ péʼe faʼa légɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: What does he mean by this?
Come over there to join me.
those there (middle distant demonstrative pronoun that refers to class 2 nouns)
those there (middle demonstrative adjective modifying class 2 nouns)
Give these people something to eat.
which ones? (asking for nouns from class 2)

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a pʉʼʉ́ kème tÿó ńzába mánzsè?
en: Which people lifted the piece of wood to start?
Go like this (that way) you come.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà à tè zẅíŋ wɔ́.
en: If it's like that, he must not accept.
